abstract: Shares in the old General Motors — now known as the Motors Liquidation Company — traded up nearly 40 percent on Friday, despite repeated warnings that they will almost certainly be worth nothing.
snippet: Shares in the old General Motors — now known as the Motors Liquidation Company — traded up nearly 40 percent on Friday, despite repeated warnings that they will almost certainly be worth nothing.
lead_paragraph: Update | 3:20 p.m. Trading in old G.M. shares was halted a little after 2 p.m. for “extraordinary events.”

headline.main: Shares in Old G.M. Still Ride High, Somehow

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
